font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: A note by [E. Thomas] shows that this paper was submitted to the Premier's office on 15 February 1886.

div.p: Baron Von Mueller called — He wished Mr Thomas to be good enough to tell Mr Service that the Book now being prepared (dedicated to Mr Service) will be ready just in time for the Exhibition in London.
The plates are ready now but the letter press cannot be completed for a month owing to pressure of business in Govt Printing Office.

Book is on
an? Exhibition Catalogue.

The Baron also wished Mr Service to leave on record a memorandum for his successor recommending favourably the claims of the Geographical Society for a Grant next year. Points out officers honorary. Cannot do anything active without assistance.

He also recommends that provision say a few hundred pounds should be made for expenses (not a salary) to England of Captn Everell who would be able to give useful information at the Exhibition and elsewhere respecting the Colonies & New Guinea

The Baron would write he says to the Royal Geographical Socy & Royal Colonial Institute stating that Mr Service is favourable to the grant to the Geographical Society and also stating what he had done for Captain Everell if he does anything

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
